Code documentationïƒ

Base library for continuous test of Odoo apps This module is Odoo version independent and may be used outside Odoo app (i.e. with odoorc package). For this reason, this software does not contain functions with sql call, like search or browse.

Functions with sql call are in test_common.py file.

class z0bug_odoo.z0bug_odoo_lib.Z0bugOdoo(release=None)ïƒ

save_row(model, row)ïƒ

Test Environment v2.0.2

Copy this file in tests directory of your module. Please copy the documentation testenv.rst file too in your module. The __init__.py must import testenv. Your python test file should have to contain some following example lines:

import os import logging from .testenv import MainTest as SingleTransactionCase

_logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

TEST_RES_PARTNER = {â€¦} TEST_SETUP_LIST = [â€œres.partnerâ€, ]

class MyTest(SingleTransactionCase):

def setUp(self):

super().setUp() # Add following statement just for get debug information self.debug_level = 2 data = {â€œTEST_SETUP_LISTâ€: TEST_SETUP_LIST} for resource in TEST_SETUP_LIST:

item = â€œTEST_%sâ€ % resource.upper().replace(â€œ.â€, â€œ_â€) data[item] = globals()[item]

self.declare_all_data(data) # TestEnv swallows the data self.setup_env() # Create test environment

def tearDown(self):

super().tearDown() if os.environ.get(â€œODOO_COMMIT_TESTâ€, â€œâ€):

# Save test environment, so it is available to dump self.env.cr.commit() # pylint: disable=invalid-commit _logger.info(â€œâœ¨ Test data committedâ€)

def test_mytest(self):
_logger.info(

â€œğŸº Testing test_mytestâ€ # Use unicode char to best log reading

def test_mywizard(self):

self.wizard(â€¦) # Test requires wizard simulator

For furthermore information, please: * Read file testenv.rst in this directory (if supplied) * Visit https://zeroincombenze-tools.readthedocs.io * Visit https://github.com/zeroincombenze/tools

declare_all_data(message, group=None, merge=None)ïƒ

Declare all data to load on setup_env().

Args:
message (dict): data message

TEST_SETUP_LIST (list): resource list to load TEST_* (dict): resource data; * is the uppercase resource name where

dot are replaced by â€œ_â€; (see declare_resource_data)

group (str): used to manager group data; default is â€œbaseâ€ merge (str): merge data with public data (currently just â€œzerobugâ€)

Raises:

TypeError: if invalid parameters issued

declare_resource_data(resource, data, name=None, group=None, merge=None)ïƒ

Declare data to load on setup_env().

Args:

resource (str): Odoo model name, i.e. â€œres.partnerâ€ data (dict): record data name (str): label of dataset; default is resource name group (str): used to manager group data; default is â€œbaseâ€ merge (str): merge data with public data (currently just â€œzerobugâ€)

Raises:

TypeError: if invalid parameters issued

Args:

resource (str): Odoo model name or name assigned, i.e. â€œres.partnerâ€ xref (str): external reference group (str): if supplied select specific group data; default is â€œbaseâ€

Returns:

dictionary with data

list of data

resource_bind(xref, raise_if_not_found=True, resource=None)ïƒ

Simulate External Reference This function simulates self.env.ref() searching for resource record. Ordinary xref is formatted as â€œMODULE.NAMEâ€; when MODULE == â€œexternalâ€ this function is engaged.

Args:

xref (str): external reference raise_if_not_found (bool): raise exception if xref not found or

if more records found

resource (str): Odoo model name

Returns:

obj: the Odoo model record

resource_create(resource, values=None, xref=None, group=None)ïƒ

Create a test record and set external ID to next tests

resource_edit(resource)ïƒ

Simulate web editing Args:

resource (str or obj): if field is a string simulate create web behavior of

Odoo model issued in resource; if field is an obj simulate write web behavior on the issued record

resource_make(resource, xref, values=None, group=None)ïƒ

Create or write a test record and set external ID to next tests

resource_write(resource, xref, values=None, raise_if_not_found=True, group=None)ïƒ

Update a test record with external

setUp()ïƒ

Hook method for setting up the test fixture before exercising it.

unicodes(src)ïƒ
wizard(module=None, action_name=None, act_windows=None, records=None, default=None, ctx=None, button_name=None, web_changes=None, button_ctx=None)ïƒ

Execute full wizard in 1 step.

Call <wizard_start> or <wizard__start_by_action_name>, then <wizard_execution>. All parameters are passed to specific functions. Both parameters <module> and <action_name> must be issued in order to call <wizard_by_action_name>.

Args:

see above <wizard_start>, <wizard__start_by_action_name> and <wizard_execution>

Returns:

Odoo wizard result; may be a windows action to engage another wizard If windows break return wizard image too

Raises:

TypeError: if invalid parameters issued

wizard_edit(wizard, field, value, onchange=None)ïƒ

Simulate view editing on a field.

Assign value to field, then engage all onchange functions on current field and on all updated fields. Finally, run onchange function issued by caller. Internal function of <wizard_execution>

Args:

wizard (object): execution wizard image field (str): field name which value is to assign value (any): value to assign to field; if None no assignment is made onchange (str): onchange function to execute after assignment

Returns:

None

wizard_execution(act_windows, records=None, button_name=None, web_changes=None, button_ctx=None, windows_break=None)ïƒ

Simulate wizard execution issued by an action.

Wizard is created by <wizard_start> with default values. First, execute onchange methods without values. Simulate user actions by web_changes that is a list of tuple (field, value);

  • fields are updated sequentially from web_changes parameters

  • a field can be updated more times

  • any updated engages the onchange funcion if defined for field

Finally, the <button_name> function is executed. It returns the wizard result or False.

Python example:
act_window = self.wizard_execution(

act_window, button_name=â€do_somethingâ€, web_changes=[

(â€œfield_a_idsâ€, [(6, 0, [value_a.id])], â€œonchange_field_aâ€), (â€œfield_b_idâ€, self.b.id, â€œonchange_field_bâ€), (â€œfield_câ€, â€œCâ€),

],

)

Args:

act_windows (dict): Odoo windows action returned by <wizard_start> records (obj): objects supplied for action server button_name (str): function name to execute at the end of then wizard web_changes (list): list of tuples (field, value); see above <wizard_edit> button_ctx (dict): context to pass to button_name function windows_break (bool): if True breaks chain and avoid view test

Warning: returns wizard image too

Returns:

Odoo wizard result; may be a windows action to engage another wizard If windows break return wizard image too

Raises:

TypeError: if invalid wizard image

wizard_launch(act_windows, records=None, default=None, ctx=None, windows_break=None)ïƒ

Start a wizard from a windows action.

This function simulates the wizard or action server starting web interface. It creates the wizard record with default values. It is useful to test:

  • view names

  • wizard structure

  • wizard code

Args:

act_windows (dict): Odoo windows action records (obj): objects required by action server default (dict): default value to assign ctx (dict): context to pass to wizard during execution windows_break (bool): if True breaks chain and avoid view test

Warning: returns wizard image too

Returns:

Odoo windows action to pass to wizard execution If windows break return wizard image too

wizard_launch_by_act_name(module, action_name, records=None, default=None, ctx=None, windows_break=None)ïƒ

Start a wizard from an action name.

Validate the action name for xml view file, then call <wizard_start>

* Example *

XML view file:
<record id=â€action_exampleâ€ model=â€ir.actions.act_windowâ€>

<field name=â€nameâ€>Example</field> <field name=â€res_modelâ€>wizard.example</field> [â€¦]

</record>

Python code:
act_windows = self.wizard_start_by_act_name(

â€œmodule_exampleâ€, # Module name â€œaction_exampleâ€, # Action name from xml file

)

Args:

module (str): module name with wizard to test action_name (str): action name default (dict), ctx (dict), windows_break (bool): see above <wizard_start> records (obj): objects supplied for action server

Returns:

Same of <wizard_start>
